intro: Finlaysonia curtisii, commonly known as the Hawaiian red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its vibrant red flowers, which bloom throughout the year, and its palm-like appearance with smooth, waxy leaves. The plant thrives in coastal and lowland areas, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. Due to its unique beauty and ecological significance, it is considered an important species in Hawaiian flora.
